Web Security

How would you advise a potential client to secure his/her website from web security attacks? Note: the word count for your answer should not be greater than 250 words

The best would be to integrate web security tools early during the software development. This can help eliminate issues early in the development phase and save time in the future. Involving the entire development team in security practices will help. By involving the entire team each person will have a sense of responsibility and a role to help keep things secure. The company will also benefit by educating the team on security practices and this can save time and money in the future as well. Some recommendations would be to use effective password management and encourage stronger password use. This can be done by using two-factor authentication for the site. The server the company is using should also be configured to use HTTPS/HTTP Strict Transport Security to encrypt data sent from the client to the server and ensure login credentials. Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) should be performed. Using vulnerability scanning tools to perform automated security testing on the site to look for vulnerabilities such as Cross-Site Scripting, SQL Injection, Command Injection, Path Traversal, and insecure server configurations. In addition, it would be best to implement penetration testing with vulnerability scanning. Penetration exercises done by a team can also continuously help maintain security awareness and improve efficiency and preparedness in case of an actual attack. (sited from https://www.acunetix.com/blog/web-security-zone)
